text: I wanted to use caiziyou but I haven't been able to find a source in the US, so I just used peanut oil. With some star anise, cinnamon (not cassia, unfortunately), cloves, fennel seeds, bay leaves, and red and green Sichuan peppercorns. Poured that over flaked arbol chilies for heat and Thai prik chee fah for nice color. :italian-chef-kiss:

attachments.title: Homemade Spicy Chili Crisp Recipe
attachments.text: This version is inspired by the original Laoganma's Spicy Chili Crisp, but taken up a notch. It's loaded with extra-large pieces of fried shallot and garlic chips, bonus aromatics for some subtle background noise, and peanuts for a nutty crunch. This recipe can easily be adapted to suit your taste.
